be.kuleuven.socialmap.database
Class DatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
  be.kuleuven.socialmap.database.DatabaseManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
MongoManager
public abstract class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract class providing methods to access the database classes. Construct a suitable DatabaseManager with the DatabaseFactory. Normally an appropriate DatabaseManager will be used automatically when you call DatabaseFactory.getDatabase(java.lang.Class, java.lang.Object[]).

All DatabaseManagers should extend this class.
DatabaseManager subclasses should define a constructor accepting one Properties object as single argument.
For every Database that the DatabaseManager subclass can create it should define a method with an 'Object...' varargs argument returning a Database<T>. The name of the method has to be the lowercased simple name of the type of objects the Database has to return.
For instance: 

 public Database<String> string(Object... args){
     return new StringDatabaseImplementation();
 }
